arts.ttl: Arsenal, Liverpool Face Setback as Newcastle in Strong Position to Extend £150M-Rated PSG Target
arts.sum: The winter transfer window has now closed, and Alexander Isak will remain at Newcastle United. Although there wasn’t much talk of a move this winter, it’s clear that several clubs will be eyeing him in the summer. arts.ttl: Man Utd, Spurs Fall to Barcelona for €37.5K-Per-Week West Ham Target Who PSG Should Pursue
arts.sum: With Randal Kolo Muani now at Juventus, Paris Saint-Germain are looking to permanently offload the French striker, whether it’s to the Turin club or another team. As a result, PSG are likely to target a No. 9 this summer. arts.ttl: Revealed: The Clause Aston Villa Refused to Add in Marco Asensio’s Loan Deal
arts.sum: During the winter transfer window, Paris Saint-Germain looked to offload players who no longer fit into their plans, and Marco Asensio was one of those on the move. Since November 30, Asensio’s role at PSG has seen a sharp decline. arts.ttl: West Ham Set to Rival Bournemouth, Fulham for Former PSG Superstar to Boost Squad
arts.sum: In 2023, Marco Verratti joined Qatari club Al-Arabi, bringing an end to his 11-year spell at Paris Saint-Germain. The transfer, reportedly worth around €45 million (£38.6 million), set a new record for the Qatar league, but could the veteran be returning to European football in the summer? arts.ttl: How Khvicha Kvaratskhelia Reacted to First PSG Goal, Win Over AS Monaco
arts.sum: Paris Saint-Germain secured a 4-1 win over AS Monaco on Friday night at Parc de Princes. The Ligue 1 leaders saw Khvicha Kvaratskhelia score his first goal for the capital club to break a one-all draw. arts.ttl: PSG reward Luis Enrique with 2-year extension
arts.sum: Paris Saint-Germain announced on Friday that it has extended coach Luis Enrique's contract until 2027.

arts.ttl: PLAYER RATINGS | PSG 4-1 Monaco: Kvaratskhelia opens account for Parisians and Dembélé scores double
arts.sum: With Paris Saint-Germain’s lead at the top of Ligue 1 verging on unassailable, what would usually have been a high-stakes clash between two of France’s major players may well have…

arts.ttl: Kvaratskhelia scores his first PSG goal as Ligue 1 leader routs Monaco
arts.sum: He showed a bit of both in the 54th minute, controlling a quick pass with his right foot, cutting cleverly inside Christian Mawissa and scooping the ball off balance over goalkeeper Radoslaw Majecki. PSG led in the sixth minute when Vitinha curled a free kick into the bottom right corner.

arts.ttl: Video: Watch Ousmane Dembélé Extend Hot Streak with Brace vs. Monaco
arts.sum: Since the calendar turned to 2025, Ousmane Dembélé has become a goal-scoring machine.
